page.title: 08The Ecology of St. Agnes
page.content: Footpaths: A beautiful wooded path goes from Barkla Shop through Jericho Valley to the sea at Trevellas Coombe. The Coastal Footpath over the cliffs passes the site of the old Wheal Kitty mine at Peterville. Stippy-Stappy, with its row of houses that look like steps, leads past woods on one side and Fairlight Glen on the other into Quay Road, and so to the sea. Climate: In summer a sea mist often descends suddenly - then frequently lifts to provide brilliant sunshine. Winter is mild - mostly damp rather than cold. Easter is often warm. Summer months lack rainfall, and (with the influx of visitors) drought conditions are quickly reached. Conservation: The National Trust owns much of the area; and along with other organisations does much to keep the countryside and its buildings safe.
